Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of tax increases, fees, regulations, and state spending on the loss of private-sector jobs in New Jersey between 2000 and 2009.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of the recession on the loss of private-sector jobs in New Jersey during the same time period.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to solely attribute the loss of private-sector jobs to tax increases, fees, regulations, and state spending.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the loss of private-sector jobs, such as the impact of the recession.
